note.para: KEYP is not supported in MSWLogo. See KEYBOARDON.

listitem.para: A predicate that outputs TRUE if there are characters waiting to be read from the read stream. If the read stream is a file, this is equivalent to NOT EOFP. If the read stream is the terminal, then echoing is turned off and the terminal is set to CBREAK (character at a time instead of line at a time) mode. It remains in this mode until some line-mode reading is requested (e.g., READLIST). The UNIX operating system forgets any pending characters when it switches modes, so the first KEYP invocation will always output FALSE.
